variable.name: STUDYID
variable.description: A unique four-digit number assigned by NIDA to each protocol, preceded by a character prefix.

variable.name: VISID
variable.description: Visit type ID according to the protocol.

variable.name: VISSEQ
variable.description: VisSeq is used in case 2 visits occur with only 1 scheduled.

variable.name: FORMSEQ
variable.description: FormSeq applies as pseudo PK when multiple readings in a "visit".

variable.name: EPOCH
variable.description: Coded number with code for dictionary, protocol specific

variable.name: FORMID
variable.description: CRF number - assigned by data center.

variable.name: AEANYAE
variable.description: Has the subject had any Adverse Events during the time period evaluated?

variable.name: AESOCLIT
variable.description: Literal term of system organ class

variable.description: A unique four-digit number assigned by NIDA to each protocol, preceded by a character prefix.

variable.description: Visit type ID according to the protocol.

variable.name: EPOCH
variable.description: Coded number with code for dictionary, protocol specific

variable.name: FORMID
variable.description: CRF number - assigned by data center.

variable.name: INCLUS1
variable.description: 1. Subject is methamphetamine experienced but not dependent, aged 18 to 45 years.

variable.name: INCLUS3
variable.description: 3. Willing and able to give written consent.

variable.name: INCLUS4
variable.description: 4. Not in the follow-up period of a preceding drug research study.

variable.name: INCLUS5
variable.description: 5. No medical contraindications from the medical history, physical examination including vital signs, 12-lead ECG, hematology, blood chemistry and urinalysis.

variable.name: INCLUS6
variable.description: 6. Use of an acceptable method of birth control.

variable.name: INCLUS7
variable.description: 7. Negative drug test (barbiturates, benzodiazepines, amphetamines, opiates, cocaine and ethanol).

variable.name: EXCLUS1
variable.description: 9. History of hematological, hepatic, respiratory, cardiovascular, renal or CNS disease or any other medical condition that is capable of altering the metabolism or elimination of drugs or of constituting a risk factor when taking the study drug.

variable.name: EXCLUS2
variable.description: 10. Recent history of methamphetamine or other drug addiction and/or alcoholism.

variable.name: EXCLUS3
variable.description: 11. Any medical condition that could relapse during or immediately after the study, and in the investigator’s opinion, interferes with study evaluations or affects a subject’s safety.

variable.name: EXCLUS4
variable.description: 12. Significant acute or chronic medical disease.

variable.name: EXCLUS5
variable.description: 13. On standard 12-lead ECG, a QTc interval >440 msec for males or >450 msec for females

variable.name: EXCLUS6
variable.description: 14. Likely to need concomitant treatment medication during the study period.

variable.name: EXCLUS7
variable.description: 15. Blood donation during the 30 days preceding study entry.

variable.name: EXCLUS8
variable.description: 16. Tobacco smoker or non-smoker for less than 3 months; i.e., a recent change in smoking status.

variable.name: EXCLUS9
variable.description: 17. Alcohol consumption averaging > 40 g daily during the past 30 days.

variable.name: EXCLUS10
variable.description: 18. Coffee (or tea) consumption > 6 cups (6 x 0.24 L) per day or xanthine containing drinks > 1 liter/day (e.g. cola drinks, etc.).

variable.name: EXCLUS11
variable.description: 19. No adequate means of contaacting the investigator in case of emergency or not able to be contacted readily by the invesigator.

variable.name: EXCLUS12
variable.description: 20. Female who is pregnant, lactating or plans to become pregnant during the study period and within one month after study drug administration.

variable.name: EXCLUS13
variable.description: 21. Exposure to any investigational new drug within 30 days of screening.

variable.name: EXCLUS14
variable.description: 22. Regular use of any prescription or over-the-counter drugs.

variable.name: EXCLUS15
variable.description: 23. Use of any herbal products likely to induce or inhibit hepatic microsomal enzyme CYP 2D6 within one month of the start of the study, including St. John’s wort (Hypericum perforatum).

variable.name: ELGBLE
variable.description: 24. Is the subject eligible for study participation?

variable.name: STUDYID
variable.description: A unique four-digit number assigned by NIDA to each protocol, preceded by a character prefix.

variable.name: VISID
variable.description: Visit type ID according to the protocol.

variable.description: Coded number with code for dictionary, protocol specific

variable.name: FORMID
variable.description: CRF number - assigned by data center.

variable.name: ABNORM
variable.description: If ECG is abnormal, please list ALL abnormalities

variable.name: PRECLUDE
variable.description: Do any of the abnormalities preclude safe entry into or continuation in the study?

variable.name: EXCLUSE
variable.description: If yes, please list the abnormalities that are exclusionary

variable.name: COMMNT
variable.description: If ECG is abnormal, please specify and provide comments below

variable.name: STUDYID
variable.description: A unique four-digit number assigned by NIDA to each protocol, preceded by a character prefix.

variable.name: VISID
variable.description: Visit type ID according to the protocol.

variable.name: VISSEQ
variable.description: VisSeq is used in case 2 visits occur with only 1 scheduled.

variable.name: FORMSEQ
variable.description: FormSeq applies as pseudo PK when multiple readings in a "visit".

variable.name: EPOCH
variable.description: Coded number with code for dictionary, protocol specific

variable.name: FORMID
variable.description: CRF number - assigned by data center.

variable.name: TERMINT
variable.description: Was subject terminated early from the trial?

variable.name: COMPLETE
variable.description: Reason subject's participation has ended (mark all that apply): Subject completed study.

variable.name: INELIGBL
variable.description: Reason subject's participation has ended (mark all that apply): Subject was determined after enrollment to be ineligible. (Provide comments)

variable.name: WITHDREW
variable.description: Reason subject's participation has ended (mark all that apply): Subject requested to withdraw. (Provide comments)

variable.name: MEDICAL
variable.description: Reason subject's participation has ended (mark all that apply): Subject experienced intercurrent illness, unrelated medical condition, or clinically significant adverse events which, in the judgment of the investigator, promped early termination. (If subject experienced adverse event(s), an Adverse Event Case Report Form(s) must be completed.) (Provide comments.)

variable.name: ADMIN
variable.description: Reason subject's participation has ended (mark all that apply): Subject terminated for administrative reasons. Include protocol non-compliance in this category. (Provide Comments)

variable.name: INCAR
variable.description: Reason subject's participation has ended (mark all that apply): Subject was incarcerated.

variable.name: PREGNANT
variable.description: Reason subject's participation has ended (mark all that apply): Subject became pregnant.

variable.name: SENSITIV
variable.description: Reason subject's participation has ended (mark all that apply): Subject developed sensitivity to study agent.

variable.name: LOSTFU
variable.description: Reason subject's participation has ended (mark all that apply): Subject was lost to follow-up.

variable.name: MOVEAWAY
variable.description: Reason subject's participation has ended (mark all that apply): Subject moved from area.

variable.name: DIED
variable.description: Reason subject's participation has ended (mark all that apply): Subject died.

variable.name: NOATTEND
variable.description: Reason subject's participation has ended (mark all that apply): Subject no longer attends lab.

variable.name: CONENVIR
variable.description: Reason subject's participation has ended (mark all that apply): Subject is in a controlled environment.

variable.name: SCRNFAIL
variable.description: Reason subject's participation has ended (mark all that apply): Subject is a screen failure.

variable.name: OTHER
variable.description: Reason subject's participation has ended (mark all that apply): Other (Provide comments)

variable.name: WILLCONT
variable.description: 1. Is subject willing to continue taking the medication?

variable.name: HEADACHE
variable.description: 2. Has subject developed a headache since the last dose?

variable.name: UNUSEVER
variable.description: 3. Is the headache unusually severe and persistent?

variable.name: VOMIT
variable.description: 4. Is the headache associated with vomiting?

variable.name: VISUAL
variable.description: 5. Is the headache associated with any visual symptoms?
